column5: Was stuck on shore but hit the lake with my dad for 45 minutes while the kids were in nap-ville.  Went 1 for 4 on the jerkbait bite while all the live-baiters came up short around me! hehe  Lost a solid 20-some incher right at shore!  Man I sucked at closing the deal on this short trip but I'm happy with my first little resident brown for 2011!      Cheers, Ryan
Damn iPhone! Can somebody please delete the other 3 posts for me
Nice Ryan.. fishing with Dad on Easter Sunday.. can't beat that! What.. you caught a fish...
Yer post count went up by 4.LOL  Nice fish Ryan and  report. TFS
Once was enough lol didn't have to rub it in !  Btw nice fish!
Such a good opener Ryan posted it several times. Nice job on the brown.
Nice brown buddy! Beauty fish
good job! I hope you have more sucess
Very nice, love the colours
nice shootin' for 45 minutes
Now Ryan, I hope you know what to do if you ever get that lure caught in a piece of wood
Nice catch. looks like a good time I am going to try my luck tomorrow hopefully.
great colors
Very nice fish, sounds like a great way to spend part of your Easter

Haha thanks guys! Haha thanks guys! Haha thanks guys! Haha thanks guys!  Oops!  It was awesome to get out with my dad even if it was just for a few minutes!  He had to help me summerize my lawn tractor, boat motor and so on or we would have fished longer...He's coming back to fish the bass opener derby with me which I'm really looking forward to as I haven't gone bass fishing with him in a while!  Now the family is about to head back to Sudbury and leave me with 3 tired kids and a wife with a bad case of the flu!  FYI - not very many ppl fish jerkbaits for resident brownies but I'm here to tell you they work, and the fish go ballistic when you hook'em!  Lots of fun!  Thanks and have a great week!  Ryan

Way to go, bud!!  Glad you made it out, and, with your dad is even more special!!  I'll have to try some jerkbaits there next time.  I pounded the water with spinners, spoons, and, small crankbaits...not even a whiff.  Had to resort to "ye olde garden hackle"  to get any takers.

Hey buddy - the guys who were shore fishing right beside us were using dew worms and only managed 1 perch and a handful of gobies in something like 6 hours.... I showed up and had a follower come right to shore on my first cast!    for me in the past ( early season)  I've gotten my bows trolling small stick type crank baits far far behind the boat along shore and when I cast jerk baits it's been %100 browns.  Also hooked some incidental bows and browns on pink trout worms while bluegill and crappie fishing in the back bays.  Cheers, Ryan
Ryan is there gobies in there? Thats very discouraging if its the place Im thinking of. Tell me its not my favorite Ontario man made lake.
Yes sir it is..... It's been infested with them since I started fishing the lake 4 years ago
Nice One!
Good going Dude    Congrats on that beauty   Awesome colors Glad your having a great start to the season Ryan Thanks for sharing Jacques
Looking good Ryan!  That's a nice trout, especially on hardware.  Gotta love schooling worm dunkers!
